affiliation.en: Former Institution / Organization University of Tsukuba Graduate School of Pure and Applied Sciences Materials Science

research_field.en: Magnetism, superconductivity, and strongly correlated systems

research_field.ja: 半導体、光物性、原子物理

paper_title.en: Anomalous temperature dependence of the optical phonon properties of Ba1-xKxBiO3 single crystals

description.en: Temperature dependence of optical phonon properties of Ba1-xKxBiO3 (x = 0, 0.15) single crystals is investigated by far infrared optical reflectivity measurements. The Kramers Kronig (KK) analysis of the reflectivity spectra yields real part of complex optical conductivity, sigma(1)(omega, T). The integrated sigma(1)(omega, T) is found to decrease with increasing temperature in contrast to the conventionally temperature independent behavior of phonons. The change noticed in the spectral weight of all individual phonons suggests the coupling of phonons with some high-energy excitations in addition to the suppression of charge density wave (CDW) amplitude. We propose interaction of phonons with the indirect excitons as one of the possibilities. (C) 2004 Published by Elsevier B.V.

paper_title.en: Anomalous temperature dependence of the optical phonon properties of Ba1-xKxBiO3 single crystals

description.en: Temperature dependence of optical phonon properties of Ba1-xKxBiO3 (x = 0, 0.15) single crystals is investigated by far infrared optical reflectivity measurements. The Kramers Kronig (KK) analysis of the reflectivity spectra yields real part of complex optical conductivity, sigma(1)(omega, T). The integrated sigma(1)(omega, T) is found to decrease with increasing temperature in contrast to the conventionally temperature independent behavior of phonons. The change noticed in the spectral weight of all individual phonons suggests the coupling of phonons with some high-energy excitations in addition to the suppression of charge density wave (CDW) amplitude. We propose interaction of phonons with the indirect excitons as one of the possibilities. (C) 2004 Published by Elsevier B.V.

paper_title.en: Optical-phonon precursory behavior towards semiconductor-metal transition in Ba1-xKxBiO3

description.en: Optical reflectivity measurements in a frequency range of 50-1000 cm(-1) have been carried out for semiconducting Ba1-xKBiO3 (BKBO) single crystals. Optical-phonon spectra exhibit the single-mode behavior in contrast to the two-mode one of BaPbxBi1-xO3 (BPBO). Frequencies plot for transverse-optical (TO) and longitudinal-optical (LO) phonons in BKBO almost coincides with the upper-mode frequencies for the two-mode BPBO derived from the terminal BaBiO3. The Szigeti-effective-charge difference Deltae(s)* between inequivalent Bi sites is estimated from the oscillator strength of the thirds highest-frequency TO-phonon mode for each concentration. The results show that Deltae(s)* is anomalously large as compared with the nominal one and tends to go to zero as x goes to a critical concentration of the semiconductor-metal transition. We conclude that the charge difference arises from a strong dynamical charge transfer during the anti-parallel vibrational motion of Bi ions.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.en: Infrared observation of the CDW amplitude decreasing due to hole doping in Ba1-xKxBiO3

description.en: Optical reflectivity measurements in the frequency range 50-1000 cm(-1) have been carried out for semiconducting Ba1-xKxBiO3 single crystals. The oscillator strength of the transverse optical phonon related to the charge-density-wave (CDW) decreases with K-doping and becomes nearly zero at a critical composition of the semiconductor-metal transition, resulting from the diminishing of the amplitude of the CDW with increasing x. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: A new IR excitation in semiconducting Ba1-xKxBiO3 single crystals

description.en: We report optical reflectivity measurements on Ba1-xKBiO3 (x = 0, 0. 15) single crystals in the frequency range 70-30 000 cm(-1) and at different temperatures in an attempt to understand the transport mechanism in the semiconducting state before it undergoes semiconductor-metal transition. For x = 0. 15, at 400 K, we find a hump in reflectivity at approximate to 1280 cm(-1). N-eff of total IR transition shifts towards low frequency as temperature increases above 300 K. We suggest the presence of new and thermally excited states in the Peierls band gap and the possible new IR excitations. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Pressure effect on Ba1-xKxBiO3 near the composition of metal-semiconductor transition

description.en: The effect of the hydrostatic pressure up to 1 GPa on the resistivity of Ba1-xKxBiO3 has been investigated. Specimens are single crystals prepared by an electro-chemical method. Either the superconducting transition temperature T-C or the conductivity increases with pressure in the metallic phase. On the semiconducting sample (x similar to 0.3), which is near the metallic phase, we find that the temperature dependence of the resistivity changes to drho/dT > 0 below 20 K at above 0.4 GPa. This suggests that the new conducting phase, which may be superconducting, appears in the semiconducting sample under high pressure. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Optical-phonon precursory behavior towards semiconductor-metal transition in Ba1-xKxBiO3

description.en: Optical reflectivity measurements in a frequency range of 50-1000 cm(-1) have been carried out for semiconducting Ba1-xKBiO3 (BKBO) single crystals. Optical-phonon spectra exhibit the single-mode behavior in contrast to the two-mode one of BaPbxBi1-xO3 (BPBO). Frequencies plot for transverse-optical (TO) and longitudinal-optical (LO) phonons in BKBO almost coincides with the upper-mode frequencies for the two-mode BPBO derived from the terminal BaBiO3. The Szigeti-effective-charge difference Deltae(s)* between inequivalent Bi sites is estimated from the oscillator strength of the thirds highest-frequency TO-phonon mode for each concentration. The results show that Deltae(s)* is anomalously large as compared with the nominal one and tends to go to zero as x goes to a critical concentration of the semiconductor-metal transition. We conclude that the charge difference arises from a strong dynamical charge transfer during the anti-parallel vibrational motion of Bi ions.

paper_title.ja: High-resolution photoemission study of low-Tc superconductors: Phonon-induced electronic structures in low-Tc superconductors and comparison with the results of high-Tc cuprates 「（共著）」
paper_title.en: High-resolution photoemission study of low-T-c superconductors: Phonon-induced electronic structures in low-T-c superconductors and comparison with the results of high-T-c cuprates

description.en: Recent advances in the energy resolution and cryogenic techniques used in photoemission spectroscopy have enabled us to directly observe the superconducting electronic structure of superconductors with a relatively lower transition temperature (low-T-c). In this paper, we report photoemission results on low-T-c superconductors measured with an ultrahigh-resolution low-temperature photoemission spectrometer. The result of Nb3Al exhibits a superconducting gap and a phonon-induced peak-dip-hump structure characteristic of the strong-coupling superconducting spectral function. From measurements of Ba0.67K0.33BiO3, We observe isotropic s-wave superconducting gap opening below T-c as well as depletion of intensity near the Fermi level above T-c, which can be attributed to a phonon-induced pseudogap. We will compare these photoemission results with those of high-T-c superconductors. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: High-resolution photoemission study of low-T-c superconductors: Phonon-induced electronic structures in low-T-c superconductors and comparison with the results of high-T-c cuprates

description.en: Recent advances in the energy resolution and cryogenic techniques used in photoemission spectroscopy have enabled us to directly observe the superconducting electronic structure of superconductors with a relatively lower transition temperature (low-T-c). In this paper, we report photoemission results on low-T-c superconductors measured with an ultrahigh-resolution low-temperature photoemission spectrometer. The result of Nb3Al exhibits a superconducting gap and a phonon-induced peak-dip-hump structure characteristic of the strong-coupling superconducting spectral function. From measurements of Ba0.67K0.33BiO3, We observe isotropic s-wave superconducting gap opening below T-c as well as depletion of intensity near the Fermi level above T-c, which can be attributed to a phonon-induced pseudogap. We will compare these photoemission results with those of high-T-c superconductors. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: Electron density distribution of Ba<sub>1-x</sub>K<sub>x</sub>BiO<sub>3</sub> (x=0.43) by ultra-short wavelength X-ray diffraction 「（共著）」

paper_title.ja: Large single crystal of Ba<sub>1-x</sub>K<sub>x</sub>BiO<sub>3</sub> grown by electro-chemical technique 「（共著）」
paper_title.en: Large single crystals of Ba1-xKxBiO3 grown by electrochemical technique

description.en:
Single crystals of the high Tc superconductor Ba1-xKxBiO3 for 0.04 &lt
 x &lt
 0.5 have been grown by an electrochemical synthesis technique with rotated melting materials of Ba(OH)2 · 8H2O, Bi2O3 and KOH in a Teflon crucible during the crystal growth. All procedures were done under flowing N2 including water vapor. The K-content x was changed by adjusting the Ba(OH)2 · 8H2O content in the melt. Under these conditions, high-quality crystals with 0.04 &lt
 x &lt
 0.5 were typically grown up to 5 × 4 × 3 mm3 in size. The crystals were characterized by EPMA, magnetic susceptibility and X-ray powder diffraction measurements. © 2001 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Physica C: Superconductivity and its Applications

paper_title.ja: Two-step Tc suppression in Pr-doped Ba<sub>1-x</sub>K<sub>x</sub>BiO<sub>3</sub> 「（共著）」
paper_title.en: Two-step Tc suppression in Pr-doped Ba1-xKxBiO3

description.en: The superconducting critical temperature Tc and normal-state magnetic susceptibility of electrochemically grown single crystals of Pr-doped Ba1-xKxBiO3 have been measured. Tc decreases as Pr concentration increases but deviates from the Abrikosov-Gor'kov theory above respective Pr concentrations of 3.5% and 1.5% for x = 0.40 and 0.53, where Tc is relaxing instead of rapid decreasing. At the crossover Pr concentration, the Curie-Weiss temperature deduced from the normal-state susceptibility changes the sign from positive to negative as Pr concentration increases. The antiferromagnetic interaction of Pr ions, which tends to make singlet pairs, reduces the Tc suppression rate. © 2001 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Physica C: Superconductivity and its Applications

paper_title.ja: Magnetic susceptibility of electron-doped BaBiO<sub>3</sub> 「(共著)」

description.en: The magnetic susceptibilities for BaBiO3-delta, Ba1-xLaxBiO3 and Ba1-xKxBiO3 were measured in order to investigate the excess paramagnetic contribution chi (p) which is found in semiconducting phase of Ba1-xKxBiO3 and BaPbxBi1-xO3. chi (p) is maximum when the Bi formal valence is +4, and decreases as the valence goes to +5 or +3. The change of chi (p) corresponds to that of the supposed density of states at the Fermi surface in a metallic phase. Coexistence of charge density wave and spin density wave is suggested in the semiconducting phase of Ba1-xKxBiO3 and BaPbx-Bi1-xO3. (C) 2001 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.
